channel.description: Test Run for my personal blog

item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
This is my front page. I’m just starting to populate my blog. I’ve added some mathjax plugin.

Right now, I am creating a personal blog for Engineering Mechanics Dynamics. If you’re interested on my project, contribute on my GitHub.

item.title: About this Theme – Path in Curvilinear Coordinates
item.description:
Curvilinear Problem Example 2

A car starts from rest at point A and increases its speed at a constant rate as it enters a curve. The magnitude of the total acceleration of the car as it passes point B, which is along the curve from point A, is . The radius of curvature at point B is 200 m.

a.) Determine the normal and tangential components of the acceleration at point B

b.) If the tangential acceleration at point B is directed downward to the right at an angle of below the horizontal and the normal acceleration is also directed downward, determine the rectangular components of the acceleration at point B.

SOLUTION:

Step 1: Draw

Just like in any of our problems, we try to visualize first the problem before solving it.
